title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 29 July 2016 - BBC News
summary: tribute to poet 120 years after popular tome .

documents.title: trademark blud - 'this charming county ' for # madeintelford
text: trademark blud - 'this charming county ' for # madeintelford

documents.title: road closed for weeks after lorry crash
text: road closed for weeks after lorry crash

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 're back in the newsroom from 08:00 on monday with more news , sport , travel and weather , but keep an eye out here for updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire strengthen shropshire ties
text: one of worcestershire 's richest seams of talent in recent seasons has been shropshire and , more specifically , shrewsbury school , where the cricket coaching staff is headed by former worcestershire fast bowler paul pridgeon , ex-shropshire man andy barnard and former warwickshire and glamorgan seamer adam shantry .

the current worcestershire squad boasts barnard 's son ed , shantry 's younger brother jack , current shropshire skipper steve leach 's elder brother joe , as well as england lions batsman joe clarke , who all came through the shropshire junior system .
latest off the production line is another shrewsbury school pupil , 19-year-old ollie westbury , who made 196 on his england under-19s debut against sri lanka at fenners this week .
he just loves batting .
lots of kids want to play t20 cricket but ollie is a proper old fashioned player who leaves the ball well and just wants to bat as long as he can . ''
author: Gerald Scott
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : taking a railway stand
text: tonight on midlands today - if you 've been commuting by train today , the chances are you had to stand .
rail passengers in birmingham are more likely to have to stand on a peak-time train , than in any other major city outside london .
new department for transport data for england and wales shows one in five passengers struggle to find a seat during the morning and evening rush hours .
i 've been looking at the figures and what we can conclude from them - see more on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: Peter Plisner
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: headlines : a41 could stay shut for weeks ; new bucks head to host youth international
text: - the a41 near hinstock could remain closed until mid-august after a lorry crashed into a house earlier this week .
- telford town park to host its first food festival this weekend
- afc telford 's new bucks head to host england youth international

documents.title: 'world war one ' plane sent on display
text: a world war one-style aircraft , built on scraps of an original bristol scout bi-plane , has gone on display for the first time after a year of flying .
david bremner from ludlow and his brother rick re-constructed the plane their grandfather `` bunnie '' bremner flew at gallipoli more than a century ago .
david admits he and his brother have spent `` around six figures '' on the project , the results of which have been on show at rnas culdrose .
they were inspired after finding the plane 's control stick , rudder bar and magneto in their grandfather 's workshop .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : weekend weather
text: to get the very latest forecasts from bbc weather , head to the website .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: clifton cinema campaigners vow to continue fight for arts centre in wellington
text: campaigners today said they are determined to bring an arts and culture centre to wellington - even if they can not buy its former cinema .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: international football coming to telford
text: telford united have been chosen to host an england youth international match later this year .
the fa has chosen the bucks head stadium as the venue for the england under-19s to play the netherlands equivalent on 1 september .

documents.title: woman gives kidney to stranger
text: a shrewsbury woman has gone ahead and donated her kidney to a stranger after finding out she was n't a suitable match for her friend as planned .
amy williams is currently recovering at home following the operation and says she 's glad it worked out .
i can give to 100 % [ of people ] , but some people can only take from 40 % i was doing it for that other person .
author: Clare Ashford
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: concerns over hours-cut at ludlow library
text: the town centre library will be open for seven hours fewer each week - a cut of more than 20 per cent .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: shifnal teenager in line for county cricket debut
text: teenager harry chandler has been called up for his shropshire county debut .
the 17-year-old wicket keeper , who normally plays at shifnal , is a product of the county 's youth and development programme .
there 's one other change as omar ali is recalled for shropshire 's match against cheshire , which begins on sunday .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire poems ' 120 years celebrated with new book
text: many soldiers who died on the world war one battlefields had a little bit of shropshire in their pockets .
`` a shropshire lad '' , an evocative collection of poems by a.e.housman , was popular during the conflict and this year marks its 120th anniversary .
peter parker , the author of a new book on housman , has paid tribute to him .
a shropshire lad has never been out of print that ca n't be said for many volumes of poems . ''
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: on this day : first ever tv weather forecast
text: sixty seven years ago today , the bbc broadcast its first ever tv weather forecast .
oh dear it appears not much changes rain is forecast today and there were showers back in 1949 as well .
# onthisday 1949 : the first ever weather forecast was broadcast on british tv .
looks about right
@ twitterid i see this is before you shrunk scotland ?
yes , but before we realized there was a giant lake in the middle of northern ireland .
another mistake - it 's a loch not lake !
haha !
well played !
but if we 're being pedantic it 's actually `` lough '' neagh !
yes , i know but i had to give you something after those gaffes !
how thoughtful !
thanks !
omg i 'm so glad you now use the curvature of the earth map - just incase the scottish people see how big their nation truly is .
@ twitterid
ssh !
stop telling the people about our nefarious plans !
never ! ! !
# freedom
# onthisday 1949 : the first ever weather forecast was broadcast on british tv .
looks about right ( via @ twitterid
at least they got it right !
interestingly , that original forecast has been accurate for the past 67 years !
@ twitterid @ twitterid
@ twitterid some things never change
before satellites they used magic
or weather balloons : )
@ twitterid bet the public wished they had n't bothered , given the forecast : - (
thought it was alway sunny and warm back in the day ?
this was the exception that proves the rule .
author: BBC Archive

documents.title: oswestry crash leaves motorcyclist in hospital
text: a motorcyclist has been taken to the royal shrewsbury hospital after colliding with a car at oswestry 's mile end roundabout .
it means the a483 is shut heading south between the roundabout and the maesbury road junction , and there are delays on surrounding routes .
police say they hope to re-open the road in the next two hours .

documents.title: transplant boy , five , turns 'athlete '
text: transplant boy , five , turns 'athlete '

documents.title: traffic slow following accident in oswestry
text: the a483 in oswestry is shut , and there are severe delays in both directions between the mile end roundabout and the maesbury road junction .
it follows an accident there earlier - police are directing traffic .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : standing on trains and blood test breakthrough
text: on midlands today this lunchtime we 'll see how rail passengers in birmingham are more likely to be forced to stand on a peak-time train than in any other major city in england and wales outside london .
plus there 's news of a revolutionary blood test to detect brain injuries which has been developed in the region .
we 'll have more on those stories and much more from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Ben Godfrey
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: ellesmere club to unveil new £ 200k building
text: ellesmere rangers football club have given us a first look at the brand new £ 227,000 changing room facility they are opening tomorrow evening .
the project was made possible thanks to a £ 95,800 grant from the premier league and the fa facilities fund .

documents.title: 'conditions ' at rabbit farm are campaigners ' main concern
text: an animal rights group protesting against plans to build a rabbit farm near newport say they are n't opposed to breeding rabbits for meat .
the main concern is that the animals could be kept indoors in cages , which compassion in world farming say is `` cruel '' .
an eastern european company , which trades online as romanian foods , has submitted an application to use land on radmore lane in gnosall for the farm .
the bbc has approached the company for comment and is awaiting a response .

documents.title: oswestry food bank looking to diversify
text: the people who run the oswestry & borders food bank say its success could lead them to offer other services , such as financial advice .
the resource , based in beatrice street , has been going for five years .
there 's also one in ellesmere .
we would love to be a debt advice centre helping people to manage money matters to pay all those bills that have to be paid . ''

documents.title: launch of ludlow loyalty card scheme
text: shops in ludlow are pinning their hopes on a loyalty card scheme to help boost business .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: telford preparing for first ever food festival
text: telford town park will welcome its first ever food festival this weekend .
the telfood feastival runs all weekend , and will feature more than 100 local food producers .
the event organisers are hoping it 'll do as well as other events they run in the county .
i think that with support , this could become an annual event we started off small in shrewsbury , and last year we had 26,000 people
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : warning over animal farm conditions ; food bank wants to help with debt
text: as we head into the afternoon , here are the main stories we are working on in the newsroom :
- concerns that rabbit farm plans could lead to animals kept in cages
- telford preparing for first ever food festival
- oswestry food bank looking to help people with debt
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : this afternoon 's weather
text: the bbc weather website 's also a great place to head to get the latest forecasts for where you live .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: former telford blockbuster store to become gym and shops
text: a telford video rental store that closed nearly three years ago could be transformed into a gym and string of new shops .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: expert says pill risk is 'rare ' following woman 's death
text: a spokesperson for the british pregnancy advisory service says complications caused by contraceptive pills are rare , after a woman from newport died from their side effects .
charlotte foster was 23 when she passed away following a blood clot in january , three weeks after seeing her gp .
the pill can lead to a very small increase in the risk of blood clots but women are far more likely to have a blood clot during pregnancy

documents.title: whitchurch woman lands dream job following accident recovery
text: a whitchurch woman says she 's delighted to be pursuing her dream of becoming a midwife after a car accident left her with serious injuries .
michelle dewsnap , 35 , broke her back in two places in a head-on collision during her second year at staffordshire university .
after taking a year out to recover from her injuries , she 's completed her degree and secured a job at the princess royal hospital in telford .

documents.title: headlines : complaints over plans for rabbit farm ; whitchurch woman recovers from car crash
text: - animal rights group objects to `` cruel '' plans for rabbit farm in gnosall
- whitchurch woman recovers from serious accident to land dream midwife job
- green party leader visiting shropshire today
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: five-year-old transplant patient excited about being athlete
text: a five-year-old boy from shrewsbury who had his second liver transplant earlier this year is competing in the british transplant games today in liverpool .
harry maceachen was given part of his dad simon 's liver after the original transplant stopped working .
joining them are his mum clare and brother sam .
harry says he 's been `` training for lots of running ! ''

documents.title: better news today for hayfever sufferers
text: it 's better for # hayfever sufferers today .
the grass pollen season is ending but there 's still weed pollen around .
when does the weed pollen end , that does it with me
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: 'clean ' gb paralym squad heading to rio
text: the shropshire-based leader of the british paralym squad is confident there are no drug cheats in the british contingent going to rio .

some russian athletes could be missing because of the country 's doping scandal , but penny briscoe from telford says they 've worked hard to ensure those selected are `` educated and best prepared to go into the games as clean athletes '' .

documents.title: animal rights campaigners upset over plans for rabbit farm
text: animal rights supporters are opposing plans to build a rabbit farm near newport .
rugeley-based company poe limited has submitted an application to use land on radmore lane in gnosall to breed the animals for `` meat , skins and as pets '' .
a group called compassion in world farming says the plans are `` cruel '' and `` outdated in modern farming '' .
the bbc has approached the company for comment .

documents.title: green party leader wants shrewsbury pool to stay
text: the green party leader natalie bennett has joined calls to keep shrewsbury 's quarry swimming pool in the town centre .
it comes ahead of her visiting shropshire to meet with local greens today .
earlier this month , shropshire council voted in favour of closing it and building a new pool in sundorne , but mrs bennett says the current site is a key asset to the local area .
if you take people out of the centre , then you 're effecting the viability of businesses there even just the vibrancy there .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : upset over plans for rabbit farm ; 'clean ' rio paralym squad
text: here are the top stories we are looking at this morning :
- animal rights campaigners oppose plans to build a rabbit farm near newport
- shropshire-based paralym boss confident no british drug cheats are going to rio
- green party leader joins calls to keep shrewsbury 's quarry swimming pool in town centre .

documents.title: watch : latest weather
text: patchy rain will move southwards through today , easing this afternoon - highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
you can read a full forecast on the the bbc weather page .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: a41 remains closed at hinstock
text: the a41 is likely to remain closed this weekend after a lorry crashed into a house earlier this week .
it 's affecting the section between the a529 in hinstock , and the a53 junction at tern hill .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning and welcome to our live page for shropshire
text: good morning from the bbc newsroom in shropshire - we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back from 08:00 on friday with more live news , sport , travel and weather , but keep an eye out here for updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: woman 'died from pill side effects '
text: woman 'died from pill side effects '

documents.title: newport family speaks out following pill death inquest
text: the family of charlotte foster , who died after taking a course of contraceptive pills , say they hope to raise awareness of the risks .
it follows a coroner 's ruling that the 23-year-old could have survived had she stopped taking dianette and started treatment for side effects when she saw her gp three weeks before her death .
`` we hope that more people and medical professionals become aware of the potential risks , however rare , of taking this medication so that no other family have to live through this nightmare .

documents.title: enterprise group asks government for £ 70m to support jobs in shropshire
text: the government is being asked to give nearly £ 70m to support business schemes in shropshire , telford and wrekin , and herefordshire .
if it agrees , more than 7,000 jobs will be created and nearly 3,000 new homes built in the region .
the cash has been requested by the marches local enterprise partnership , and proposals include creating a £ 13.2m oswestry innovation park which would provide an estimated 1,400 jobs .
a 23-hectare site , adjacent to the town 's mile end roundabout , has already been allocated .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: walsall sign winger ginnelly on loan
text: walsall sign winger ginnelly on loan

documents.title: headlines : family heartache following pill death ; shrewsbury boy turns athlete after liver transplant
text: here are the top stories for shropshire as we head into the evening :
- newport family raises awareness following daughter 's death from contraceptive pills
- five-year-old shrewsbury boy speaks of delight to be competing at british transplant games
- the made in telford mural is complete .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: photos : telford artwork complete
text: it started off as a blank canvas , but after four days of hard work , the made in telford mural is complete .
the iron bridge , raf cosford , the wrekin giant and telford tigers are all things you 'll be able to spot .
the artist , neil willis , has thanked everyone who came up with suggestions for the project , and says he 's delighted with how the colours fit together in the finished product .

documents.title: watch : weather for the rest of today
text: for weather forecasts at another time , bookmark our bbc weather website .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shropshire councillors agree to cut hours at 11 libraries across county
text: a cut to shropshire 's library hours has been agreed by councillors , who have also backed a move to close a village library .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: get set , go : five-year-old turns athlete following liver transplant
text: a shrewsbury boy who had his second liver transplant earlier this year is off to compete in the british transplant games .
five-year-old harry maceachen was given part of his dad simon 's liver .
harry 's whole family has entered the games which encourage patients to regain their fitness after operations .
tonight is the opening ceremony in liverpool .

documents.title: headlines : newport woman 'died from contraceptive pill ' ; shrewsbury mp calls for polish co-operation ahead of brexit
text: - coroner rules that a newport woman died from contraceptive pill side-effects which went untreated
- shrewsbury mp urges poland to understand migration issues amid brexit negotiations
- five-year-old boy turns athlete following liver transplant
author: Faith Page
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire woman 'died from contraceptive pill side-effects '
text: a shropshire woman died from the untreated side effects of a combined oral contraceptive pill , an inquest has found .

coroner john ellery said it was more likely than not that 23-year-old charlotte foster from newport would 've survived had dianette been stopped and treatment started when she saw her gp three weeks before her death in january this year .
the inquest also found she was presenting symptoms of a pulmonary embolism during her final gp appointment on 4th january but she was instead being treated for lower back pain .

documents.title: new jetties for boats to dock in ellesmere
text: two new jetties have been created on either side of the mere in ellesmere .
the moorings at the town 's boat house restaurant and penley woods have been paid for using money from the 5p tax on plastic bags .
it 's hoped they 'll bring more visitors to enjoy the area over the summer holidays , with free boat rides being offered this weekend .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: milk price row : call for shropshire dairy farmers to get a fairer deal
text: a shropshire campaign group is calling for retailers and processors to ensure that dairy farmers get their fair share '' of the recent increase in milk prices .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: firefighters clear up flood at wellington school
text: firefighters have been helping out at a flooded school in telford .
a burst pipe led to water filling the main hall at wrekin view primary school in wellington .
there were concerns about the water posing an electrical hazard , but shropshire fire and rescue service says the problem has now been resolved .

documents.title: photos : shropshire farmer celebrates excellent lavender harvest
text: travelling through the county this summer you 'll see an array of colours - from yellow oilseed rape to the green grass on the shropshire hills .
look carefully and you may see some purple streaks too , as it 's been a great year for growing lavender .
i 've been to visit farmer robin spencer at shropshire lavender in pickstock , where the crop is being harvested .
author: Ian Perry
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: public meeting ahead of water works in bishop 's castle
text: severn trent water is hosting a public exhibition this afternoon before water works are carried out in bishop 's castle .
roughly four miles of old water pipes need to be replaced , with the work scheduled to start next month .
there 's an opportunity to meet the team behind the project at teme sparc leisure centre between 4pm and 7pm .

documents.title: shropshire groups given £ 300,000 in arts funding
text: three groups in shropshire are to share more than £ 300,000 in grants from the arts council .
arts alive , pentabus theatre , and the hive centre in shrewsbury have each been given money as part of a £ 17.5m national project .
the investment aims to help the groups become more sustainable , and thereby more attractive to private sponsors in the future .

documents.title: watch : afternoon weather
text: outbreaks of rain , possibly heavy in places , will move east across all parts .
brighter conditions with isolated heavy , possibly thundery , showers will then develop later .
highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
you can read a full forecast on the bbc weather page .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: shrewsbury mp calls for poland to co-operate over brexit
text: shrewsbury and atcham mp daniel kawczynski says the polish government `` must start to understand and respect '' the problem he says britain has with migration .
it comes as pm theresa may visits poland to discuss brexit and what it could mean for its citizens living and working in the uk .
the polish-born mp spoke on the bbc 's victoria derbyshire programme earlier today :
polish born conservative mp @ twitterid says unchecked migration is bad for both poland and uk .
# victorialive
in fact poland is taking a much more sensible attitude to immig ' both restricting & checking
jobs 4 brits
smart guy !
its only bad on where people are coming from !
@ twitterid @ twitterid bloody cheek , migration and pop growth for poland is in negative figures .
a pole voting tory is a traitor to his own people and ours

documents.title: more homes in plan for telford 's lawley village expansion
text: plans have been submitted for the next phase of housing developments in an area that could bring more than 260 homes .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : ambulance queues 'down to rural county ' ; mp wants polish co-operation ahead of brexit
text: as we head into the afternoon , these are the major stories here in shropshire :
- ambulance service blames county 's rural nature for long waiting times
- shrewsbury mp urges poland to understand britain 's migration problems
- shropshire groups given arts council grants totaling £ 300,000
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: made in telford mural nearing completion
text: all this week , our team has been working with graffiti artist neil willis to create a mural celebrating everything telford has to offer .
the wrekin , boxer richie woodhall , and paralympic champion mickey bushall have all made it up there .
if you think there 's something we 've missed , there 's still time to get in touch by email , twitter or via our facebook page .

documents.title: ambulance service defends itself over patient queues in shrewsbury
text: west midlands ambulance service says it fails to meet government waiting time targets at the royal shrewsbury hospital because it 's based in a rural county .
spokesman mark docherty says in more urban areas , there 's more choice of alternative hospitals to which to send patients .
ccg figures reveal just 5 % of patients were handed over within the 15-minute target time last month .
in very urban areas if one hospital starts to get very busy , we can start to divert to other hospitals in places like shropshire , that just is n't realistically possible .

documents.title: community pubs offer boost amid closures
text: it 's a mixed among pubs in shropshire .
thirteen have closed in the last year , but new ones are springing up too .
two micro-pubs have recently opened in ludlow , and another one 's on the cards .

the expansion of community-run pubs like the pheasant at neenton , near bridgnorth , is giving the campaign for real ale ( camra ) hope that this type of ownership could breath new life into the industry .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: could major concerts be on the way to telford 's new bucks head ?
text: concerts and big events could be coming to afc telford , under the charge of the club 's new commercial manager .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: minister to look into road improvements in north shropshire
text: there could be a second ministerial visit to look at how two main roads in the north of the county could be improved .

following changes to the government in the wake of theresa may 's appointment as prime minister , the new transport minister john hayes says he wants to see for himself why the cases for turning the a5 around oswestry into a dual-carriageway and bypassing pant and llanymynech on the a483 should be made a priority .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: a41 remains closed after hinstock lorry crash
text: the a41 near hinstock is still closed and is likely to remain so into the weekend after a lorry crashed into a house on tuesday night .
the vehicle has now been taken away , revealing the damage to the property , which was empty at the time of the collision .

documents.title: council seeks to cut bus subsidies by up to three quarters
text: the extent of the cuts shropshire council plans to make to local bus subsidies has emerged .
it wants to reduce the annual £ 1.8m bill by up to three-quarters over the next four years .
full details are still being worked out but there will be service cuts and the authority will rely more on volunteers to put on smaller community routes .
inevitably , if a bus route is not financially viable we will not be able to support it to the amount we have been able to support it .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: southwater car park closure : repair delays caused by insurance claims
text: repairs to a busy car park that was damaged in a major blaze were delayed due to insurance claims resulting from the incident .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : ambulance waiting times fall short of government targets ; buses facing large budget cuts
text: - queuing ambulances mean patients facing waits at royal shrewsbury hospital
- shropshire council looking to cut three-quarters of its budget for buses in next four years
- more than 100 pub closures across the midlands
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: midlands loses more than 100 pubs
text: the midlands has more than a hundred fewer pubs than it did six months ago , according to the campaign for real ale ( camra ) .
while 129 have opened across the region , 241 have closed and camra say it 's rural and suburban pubs that are the worst hit .
it adds that those not serving food are also struggling but the expansion of places serving food and the increase in demand for craft beer is seen as a positive .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: long delays for ambulances at royal shrewsbury hospital
text: latest figures show that as many as 14 ambulances at a time have been forced to queue as they wait to transfer patients to the royal shrewsbury hospital .
that 's twice as many as the hospital is designed to cope with .
last month just 5 % of patients were handed over within the government 's 15-minute target time , according to the ccg data .
of the 1374 patients taken to the rsh last month , two out of three had to wait for more than half an hour , with almost 100 patients waiting longer than an hour .
the delays affect subsequent 999 calls and will also result in a fine for the hospital .
a system that would divert ambulances to other hospitals has been discussed but problems surrounding the distances involved are yet to be overcome .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : accident on a41 between hinstock and tern hill
text: there are significant delays on the a41 in both directions due to an accident between the a529 ( hinstock ) and the a53 ( tern hill ) .
there 's also disruption on the a458 victoria road in much wenlcok at the junction with the b4371 due to traffic light failure .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : this morning 's weather
text: you can get local updates at any time from the bbc weather website .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: headlines : long delays for ambulances ; bus budgets slashed
text: the main stories in shropshire this morning :
- latest figures show as many as 14 ambulances at a time have been forced to queue while waiting to transfer patients to royal shrewsbury hospital
- shropshire council wants to reduce the £ 1.8m it pays annually in bus subsidies by up to three-quarters over the next four years
- minister to examine case for adding a lane to the a5 around oswestry
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live in shropshire
text: good morning from bbc local live for shropshire .
i 'm in the newsroom , bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: lorry embedded in side of house
text: lorry embedded in side of house

documents.title: woman admits decapitating pet snakes
text: woman admits decapitating pet snakes

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: cricket : shropshire make two changes
text: reacting to their first minor counties defeat of the season , shropshire make two changes to their side for this weekend 's game against cheshire at nantwich .
omar ali is recalled in place of tom weston and there 's a debut for harry chandler behind the stumps in place of luke tinsley .
chandler , who plays his club cricket for shifnal , is just short of his 18th birthday , and is another product of shropshire 's youth and development programme .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : pictures of coalport and lyth hill
text: these photos have been sent to us by rebecca knight , who has been to visit the inclined plane at coalport ( top ) and lyth hill ( bottom ) .
we love the image of the fields , you can almost feel the breeze blowing across them .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : a dry and cloudy night ahead
text: it 's forecast to be mild , cloudy and dry overnight .
maybe this evening is the time to get that lawn cut .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shropshire paralympian tries not to think about the pressure
text: shropshire 's ben rowlings says he 's determined not be overawed after being called up for his paralympic debut for great britain in september .
rowlings , from newport , is confident he is physically prepared for the games and is n't concerned about the climate in brazil .
instead , he says his main concern will be `` making sure i do n't get too stressed out by the pressure of it '' .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: woman used scissors and knife to kill pet snakes
text: a market drayton woman used a knife and a pair of scissors to cut the heads off two pet snakes , telford magistrates have been told .
jennifer lampe , who is 28 , had been drinking heavily and retreated to her room , where the python and the boa constrictor were kept , following an argument .
the magistrates indicated they are considering a custodial sentence after lampe pleaded guilty to beheading the snakes .

documents.title: latest : woman admits beheading snakes ; a41 crash site to remain closed ; library to shut
text: our top stories this evening :
- market drayton woman admits beheading two pet snakes
- a41 near hinstock to remain closed this evening after lorry crash
- shropshire council votes to shut one library and reduce hours at 11 others
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: road likely to remain closed this evening after lorry crash
text: shropshire council says the a41 at shakeford , near hinstock , is likely to remain closed this evening .
a lorry crashed into the building last night and the authority says the it is embedded in a supporting wall , which needs to be made safe before the vehicle is removed .

the main diversion route takes vehicles up to the ternhill island , then onto the a53 towards hodnet , and the a442 into the telford and wrekin area , then onto the b5062 at crudgington towards newport , before re-joining the a41 .

documents.title: breakingmarket drayton woman admits beheading snakes
text: a 28-year-old woman has pleaded guilty to beheading her two pet snakes after a row with her family .
jennifer lampe , of shropshire street , market drayton , killed the 2m ( 6ft ) long boa constrictor and 1.5m ( 5ft ) long python after drinking heavily .
telford magistrates court heard that she had feared being thrown out of the home she shared with her sister and her family and became hysterical .
the prosecution on behalf of the rspca said the police had found her covered in blood , with a headless snake still moving around her neck .
she will be sentenced next month .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford paralympic chief sees 'massive cloud of doubt ' over russians
text: great britain 's paralym de mission , penny briscoe , who 's from telford , believes the russian doping crisis has cast a `` massive cloud of doubt '' over the paralympic games too .
she described it as a `` complex environment '' and said it was difficult to say what the right answer to the situation was .
ms briscoe said she was sure there were many clean russian athletes , but wanted the guidance of the international paralympic committee .
there is a massive cloud of doubt over the russian national paralympic commitee at this moment and we wait to find out how the exactly the ipc is going to progress . ''

documents.title: watch : telford rapper writes song about bbc shropshire mural
text: the work on bbc radio shropshire 's mural in telford town centre is into its third day now .
it 's being created by a local graffiti artist , based on ideas from people living in the area , and today we had a visit from a local rapper .
he told us he had written a little song about it .
author: Paul Shuttleworth
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire wedding party step in to aid family stuck in ditch
text: a shropshire wedding party stepped in to help after a young family found themselves stuck in a rut .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: your photos : cliff railway in bridgnorth
text: with the school holidays underway , the cliff railway in bridgnorth should be a popular attraction , although it looks a little empty in this photo taken by bbc weather watcher , ernie .
if you have photos you would like to share , you can get in touch by email , twitter or by commenting on our facebook page .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: latest : hours cut at libraries and one to close ; second lorry may have been involved in a41 crash
text: our headlines this afternoon include :
- shropshire council votes to close one library and reduce hours at 11 others
- police believe second lorry involved in a41 crash
- shropshire cheese maker wins 44 awards at nantwich
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: heart of england in bloom judges visit shrewsbury
text: the heart of england in bloom judges have been visiting shrewsbury , having already seen the displays in oswestry and ludlow .
on monday they were taking a look around newport and today they got to meet ( among others ) the town 's mp , daniel kawczynski .
meeting judges from heart of england in bloom .
thank you to @ twitterid & @ twitterid for all the work !

documents.title: football : shrewsbury town learn football league trophy opponents
text: the draw 's been made for the revamped football league trophy .
it was previously for league one and two sides , but has now expanded and starts in groups of four , with shrewsbury town paired with middlesbrough , scunthorpe and cambridge .
town 's manager , micky mellon , says they face three good clubs and he 'll be taking the competition seriously .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire council votes to close library and cut hours at 11 others
text: shropshire councillors have voted to cut library hours at 11 libraries in the county and close shawbury 's library altogether .
it 's being done as part of moves to cut the council 's budget and shawbury will get visits from a mobile library instead .
a meeting of the authority 's cabinet committee heard that attempts had failed to find someone willing to take over the running of the shawbury library .

documents.title: your photos : a damp start to the day across the county
text: we 've seen lots of photos of wet weather from around the county this morning , but it is forecast to dry up a bit later .
this was taken by one of the bbc weather watchers near norton in hales .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : police believe second lorry involved in a41 crash
text: the police have told us that a second lorry may have been involved in the crash on the a41 near hinstock last night .
it resulted in another lorry colliding with a house .
sergeant mike waterworth has been talking to our reporter .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: railway trespass warning to shropshire youngsters
text: an urgent warning is being issued to young people in shropshire about trespassing on railway lines .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: shrewsbury politician criticises ukip leadership favourite
text: the suspended ukip politician , suzanne evans , who has a home in shrewsbury , has described the leadership front-runner steven woolfe as a `` showman '' who does n't have `` the attention to detail '' needed .
mrs evans has given up on her own leadership ambitions for now and is supporting another candidate , lisa duffy , instead .
she wants to see changes to the way the party is run , after complaining nigel farage had `` surrounded himself with yes men '' .
while she accepts mr woolfe has `` many admirable qualities '' she believes he wo n't be able to reform ukip .
my concern about steven is that he is a great showman , he is very good at making ra-ra speeches and rallying the troops , but he will not be able to change the leadership we have at the moment .
he will not be able to clean the party up . ''

documents.title: latest : scaffolding for house hit by lorry ; evans criticises ukip leadership front-runner ; cheese maker wins multiple awards
text: our top stories this lunchtime include :
- temporary wooden scaffolding erected to support house hit by lorry
- shrewsbury politician criticises ukip leadership front-runner
- shropshire cheese maker wins 44 awards at international show
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : afc telford united lose wrexham friendly
text: afc telford united staged a late comeback , but ended up losing their friendly against wrexham 3-2 last night .
a crowd of just under 600 saw them go 3-0 down early in the second half , before hitting back with a penalty from josh wilson on 63 minutes .
the hosts scored a second on 87 minutes , through tom peers , but were unable to force an equaliser .

documents.title: weather : light cloud with some sunshine this afternoon
text: the rain should clear this afternoon to leave us with light cloud and a little sunshine .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: 1860 's shropshire railway station open to the public
text: there will be a chance to learn more about a 19th century shropshire railway station this evening .
shrewsbury railway heritage trust is hosting a walk , starting at the old abbey station in shrewsbury , which was used to transport ammunition during world war two .
and you might learn things about the town you did n't already know .
for instance this pavement was once a station platform .

it was the start of the railway mania in the 1860 's , when they were building railways everywhere a passenger service finished in 1933 , then the war department took it over , and that was the line 's busiest [ period ] . ''
author: Ian Perry
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : the new saints put nine past fc oswestry
text: the friendly match between oswestry 's two top sides ended with a one-sided 9-0 win for the new saints over fc oswestry .
alex darlington scored a hat-trick and there were also goals for robbie parry , chris seargeant , greg draper ( below ) and two from adrian cieslewicz .
the other goal was scored by an un-named player on trial with tns .

documents.title: photos : lorry embedded in hinstock house
text: here are some more photos of the lorry which crashed into a house near hinstock .
it happened at 22:45 yesterday and the a41 between tern hill and wistanswick will be closed for most of the day .

documents.title: field hospital on display in shrewsbury today
text: the field hospital seen at oswestry 's orthopaedic hospital yesterday will be visiting the royal shrewsbury hospital today and telford 's princess royal hospital tomorrow .
it looks impressive , but it 's small in scale compared to a full-sized one .
this one has just two tents connected to each other , but this model gives you an idea of the scale of the real thing .
yesterday was special for two reservists working at the hospital , lt col maggie durrant ( left ) and sgt rebecca warren ( right ) because both were presented with volunteer reserve service medals .

documents.title: shropshire cheesemaker 's multiple wins at international show
text: whitchurch-based belton cheese has 44 awards at the nantwich international cheese show .
they include prizes for its cheshire cheese and for its waxed cheese and another for being the exhibitor winning the highest number of points overall .
the judges had to taste over 5,000 cheeses yesterday before making their decisions .
it 's enough to give you nightmares .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: latest : road closed by lorry crash ; bus subsidy review ; sheep farmer 's brexit worries
text: our top stories this morning :
- a41 at hinstock likely to be closed for the rest of the day after lorry hits house
- shropshire council reviewing bus subsidies
- sheep farmers voice brexit concerns
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shifnal woman found dead in shrewsbury hotel died from accidental heroin overdose
text: a woman who was found dead in a hotel died after an accidental heroin overdose .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: shropshire council looking into bus service cuts
text: more bus service cuts appear to be on the way in shropshire .
officials from shropshire council meet today to decide which routes are more important , having already listed the ludlow town service as their number one priority to keep .
the authority has been reducing subsidies as part of its overall plan to reduce spending by £ 77m over the next four years .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: a41 likely to be closed 'for the rest of the day ' after hinstock crash
text: shropshire fire and rescue service say the a41 could be closed `` for the rest of the day '' after a lorry crashed into a house at shakeford , near hinstock .

documents.title: could major concerts be on the way to telford 's new bucks head ?
text: concerts and big events could be coming to afc telford , under the charge of the club 's new commercial manager .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: sheep farmers should be 'planning for the worst ' ahead of brexit
text: shropshire 's sheep farmers have been urged to act , so they are prepared for britain to leave the european union .
that 's according to the national sheep association , which is calling on the government to do everything it can to protect money given to farmers as eu subsidies .
the organisation 's chief executive , phil stocker , is also warning that farmer 's trade could be badly affected , in the event of brexit .
a big volume of our agricultural products are exported into europe we need to work hard to make sure we protect that trade . ''

documents.title: latest : sheep farmers warned about brexit ; a41 closure at hinstock ; bus service cuts considered
text: here are the latest stories we are looking at in shropshire :
- shropshire 's sheep farmers told they should be `` planning for the worst '' after brexit vote
- a41 said to be closed `` for the rest of the day '' around hinstock after lorry crash
- shropshire council looking at which bus services to cut
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : damp and drizzly start improves later
text: it 's set to be a tale of two halves today .
wet this morning , but brightening up this afternoon .
highs of 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : lorry crash causing congestion at hinstock
text: there are severe delays on the a41 around hinstock this morning .
traffic is slow between the a529 chester road junction and the hatton road junction , because of an accident involving a lorry .
more from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning and welcome to our live page for shropshire
text: good morning from the bbc newsroom in shropshire .
this is your place for all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
you can get in touch by email , twitter or by commenting on our facebook page .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: football : the new saints to play fc oswestry tonight
text: the new saints of oswestry play fc oswestry tonight in a friendly match at park hall stadium .
the match has a 19:30 kick off .
and they wo n't be the only welsh side playing in the county tonight , because afc telford united have a friendly at the bucks head against wrexham .

documents.title: weather : a cloudy evening with some rain
text: it 's going to remain cloudy across shropshire and some areas may see some showers later .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: shropshire man died in peru after wanting to spend time by himself
text: the inquest into the death of a shropshire man who fell from a cliff in peru heard he had been trekking through the jungle with a group of friends , but left them two days before his 30th birthday to spend time by himself .

they had been in the cuzco region , famous for its inca ruins , and the inquest heard that while there were some well-trodden routes , it was mountainous with dense jungle - and dangerous without a guide .
after a nine-day search involving helicopters , drones , police and local volunteers , his tent and equipment were found at the top of a preci and his body 40m below in a ravine .
it 's thought that because of the rations he 'd used , he must have died very close to , if not actually on , the day of his birthday .
a verdict of accidental death was recorded .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : dangers of open water
text: emergency services in the midlands are warning of the dangers of swimming in open water , especially during the school holidays .
in the past week , eight people across the uk have died after swimming in rivers , quarries and lakes , including 46-year-old sylwester ficon in burton upon trent .
you can see lindsay doyle 's report on midlands today on bbc one from 18:30 tonight .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: olym shropshire wheelchair athlete going to third games
text: shropshire 's mickey bushell who won gold at london 2012 will be off to his third paralym at just 26 .
he has been selected to represent great britain at 100m and 400m wheelchair events and is a reserve for the relays .
his father , peter bushell , has followed his son to competitions all around the world but wo n't be going to rio , joking it is far too hot over there .
he 's had a couple of rough years with injury and illness , but this year , touch wood , he is right on form and we 're incredibly proud of him . ''

documents.title: peru tourist 'lost footing ' on solo trek
text: peru tourist 'lost footing ' on solo trek

documents.title: headlines : harry greaves peru death an accident ; politician abandons ukip leadership bid ; team gb call up for pair
text: our top stories this evening :
- inquest rules shropshire 's harry greaves died as a result of an accident in peru
- shrewsbury politician abandons ukip leadership bid
- shropshire wheelchair athletes selected to represent great britain
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: southwater car park to close for repairs
text: the multi-storey car park at telford 's southwater development will be completely closed for a week , starting next monday .

it 's to repair the damage done by the car fire last month and while the first two floors will reopen the following monday ( 8 august ) , it could be an additional two weeks before the other floors are back in use .
next monday , workmen will also start laying electric cables from the southwater one building to the front of meeting point house .
that work is expected to take three or four weeks and will involve the paving being dug up .

documents.title: watch : a look around the field hospital set up in oswestry
text: a small army field hospital has been erected at the robert jones and agnes hunt hospital at gobowen today , as part of a recruitment campaign .
there are regular demonstrations going on throughout the day .
the army medics took us for a tour of the tent .

documents.title: watch : bbc shropshire mural gets a visit from champion boxer
text: work on bbc shropshire 's mural in telford town centre is well under way now , with the idea that it celebrates the things you like about the county .
one of the images is of shropshire 's richie woodhall lifting his world championship boxing belt .
he dropped in today to take a look , telling us he would n't live anywhere other than telford , his home town .
author: Paul Shuttleworth
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: whitchurch man arrested on sus of rape
text: a whitchurch man has been arrested on sus of rape .
author: Whitchurch Herald

documents.title: your photos : dramatic dark clouds over shropshire
text: we 've had some impressive photos of clouds over the county sent in during the last 24 hours .
this one was taken near market drayton last night by one of the bbc weather watchers .
you can share your photos through email , twitter or by commenting on our facebook page .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire athletes make selection for paralym
text: two of the county 's wheelchair racers have been included in the squad for the paralympic games in september .
mickey bushell from telford is looking to defend his title , having won gold at the event in london four years ago .
he 'll be joined by 20-year-old ben rowlings from newport , who 'll be making his paralympic debut .

documents.title: harry greaves inquest records verdict of accidental death
text: an inquest in shrewsbury into the death of a man who fell from a cliff in peru has recorded a verdict of accidental death .
harry greaves , from bronygarth near oswestry , is said to have lost his footing during a trek in the peruvian andes in april .
the 29-year-old 's body was found two weeks after he was reported missing .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : harry greaves peru death ruled an accident ; evans abandons ukip leadership bid ; iron age coin collection bought
text: here 's a look at our top stories this afternoon :
- bronygarth man 's death in peru was an accident , inquest rules
- shrewsbury politician abandons ukip leadership bid
- shropshire museum acquires collection of iron age coins
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: museum gets collection of iron age gold coins
text: shrewsbury 's museum has bought a collection of 2,000-year-old gold coins which were found in a field near claverley by metal detectors last year .
the museum says they were buried just before or after the roman invasion on the edge of the lands belonging to the cornovii tribe .
the seven coins will go on display on 1 august .
iron age artefacts from shropshire are rare and iron age coin hoards from the midlands and western britain are very rare indeed .
this is the first recorded iron age coin hoard from shropshire and so we wanted to make sure the coins were kept together . ''

documents.title: watch : bbc shropshire mural takes shape in telford
text: we 're into the second day of bbc radio shropshire 's project to create a giant mural in telford .
the idea is that it will say something about the county and we 're being helped by local graffiti artist neill willis .
here 's a look at the work we did on day one .
this video has no sound .
author: Paul Shuttleworth
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : army medics demonstrate field hospital
text: army medics are at the robert jones and agnes hunt orthopaedic hospital today , demonstrating a field hospital .
this time lapse video was taken earlier this morning on the hospital 's sports field .
field hospitals can contain more than 300 beds and be as well-equipped as an acute nhs hospital .

documents.title: evans gives up hope of ukip leadership bid
text: ukip ex-deputy chairwoman suzanne evans says she has given up hope of becoming the party 's next leader - but insists she will not `` give up '' on ukip .
ms evans , who lives in shropshire , is currently suspended from ukip .
she said she would `` very much like '' to run but a `` handful of people at the top '' had ensured she could not .
ms evans ' six-month ban for bringing the party into disrepute - claims she has dismissed - means she can not stand .
she said she would back councillor lisa duffy to succeed nigel farage .

documents.title: bucks head could host concerts
text: lee griffiths , the new commercial manager at afc telford united , is looking at ways to increase the use of the bucks head stadium - and that might involve concerts .
he is drawing from his experiences in his last post at northamptonshire cricket club , where he hosted artists including madness and tom jones .
mr griffiths said the events had attracted crowds of 12,000 people .
it 's getting the right person in the right place and making sure the demand is there for it . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: new chief fire officer appointed
text: shropshire has got a new chief fire officer .
it 's rod hammerton , the former deputy chief fire officer , who has has been doing the job on a temporary basis since the retirement of john redmond last month .
he moved to shropshire two years ago , after 15 years with hampshire 's fire service and he is warning that finances will continue to be stretched .
we know this period of austerity in the public sector is far from over but shropshire fire and rescue has n't used that as an excuse to lower their standards . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : former albrighton station house becomes pub
text: the old station master 's building at albrighton railway station will re-open as a pub on friday .
it has been vacant for seven years and decorators were putting the finishing touches to the bar when i visited .
owner paul thompson told us he was using his children 's university money to pay for it , hoping it will be an investment .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : politician gives up ukip leadership bid ; council admits child sex figures are 'shocking '
text: our top stories this lunchtime :
- shrewsbury politician gives up ukip leadership bid
- telford and wrekin council admits child sex offence figures are 'shocking '
- new chief fire officer selected
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : a grey day with some rain later
text: it 's going to be another grey and cloudy day with some rain around this evening .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: shropshire hopes at international 'cheese off '
text: a number of shropshire cheese producers are hoping to win more trophies at the nantwich international cheese awards .
the judges have started their work this morning , tasting more than 5,000 cheeses .
judging underway now
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : complaints about convoy of turbine-parts
text: there have been people out on the roads around shropshire with cameras , keen to catch site of the lorries carrying wind-turbine parts to a site in mid-wales .
but some people are unhappy with the convoys .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shropshire woman gives up on ukip leadership
text: suzanne evans , the former ukip deputy chairman who has a home in shrewsbury , has announced she is giving up her bid to lead the party .

ms evans has previously said she would be interested in succeeding nigel farage , but is currently suspended from the party and would n't have met the criteria to stand because she has n't been a member for long enough .
instead , she said she would support the leadership campaign of lisa duffy , a cambridgeshire councillor .

documents.title: shropshire man , 70 , jailed for historical sex attacks on boys
text: a shropshire pensioner has been jailed for more than 13 years after being found guilty of historical sex offences against boys - some dating back 50 years .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: investigation into telford councillor 'blown out of proportion '
text: a labour party investigation into a telford and wrekin councillor has been described as a `` storm in a teacup '' .
lee carter took to twitter last week to say he was under investigation over his decision not to back jeremy corbyn to remain as labour leader .
party bosses say they are looking into whether councillor carter voted at two branch meetings , which is against the rules .
the chair of the party 's south telford branch , derek white , says the issue has been blown out of proportion and that councillor carter has his support .
i'n now under investigation by local lp for not supporting jc .
sad times .
love for labour will not leave me .
crazy .
what happened to democratic choice ?
it 's alive as long as you support jc by the looks !
stick to your principles .
political bullies are the worst kind !
there are 13 complainants in total- add a nought to that number and i 'd bat an eyelid .
frankly ?
sod 'em !
while they 're busy writing letters and quashing dissent , i 'll be busy representing people of college and doing best for t & w
yes .
the best way forward .
genuinely have some sympathy for moderate members of lab party .
take this the right way mate- but that shows how bad things are : - )
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: roadworks costing £ 500,000 begin in newport
text: roadworks costing £ 500,000 start in newport this morning .
the work to resurface and repair the roads in and around the town is expected to take around eight weeks .
today , workers are starting on the junction between high street , avenue road , wellington road and upper bar .

documents.title: headlines : council says child sex offence figures are 'shocking ' ; newport roadworks start ; labour downplays councillor investigation
text: our top stories this morning :
- child sex offences figures are 'shocking ' , council says .
- newport roadworks start today
- labour party investigation into senior councillor described as 'storm in a teacup '
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: arson attack on new pavilion
text: police link incident at refurbished cricket facility to shed blaze .
more in today 's edition of the oswestry and border counties advertiser
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: council admits child sex crime data is 'shocking '
text: a spokesperson for telford and wrekin council says the latest government statistics on child sex offences are 'shocking ' .
the figures show 310 offences reported in the authority 's area in the last financial year - with 551 across the whole of shropshire .
that 's up from 196 in the county in 2011-12 .
child protection officer tina knight said the figures , based on `` police data '' , were different to council figures for cases of child sexual exploitation .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire athlete among those waiting on paralympic selection
text: newport wheelchair racer ben rowlings is among those waiting to hear whether they 've been selected for the paralympic games .
this september 's event in rio would be the 20-year-old 's first paralym
he already has three bronze medals from the european championships earlier this year .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: residents complain about daily wind turbine deliveries
text: people who live in pant are unhappy at the prospect of huge wind turbines being transported through their village during the summer holidays .
the first convoy passed through yesterday , on the way to a new wind farm being built in mid-wales .
there 'll be one of these convoys every day , six days a week , for the next two months .

documents.title: traffic problems heading out of shropshire
text: the roads inside our county are moving well at the moment , but there is severe disruption travelling north on the m6 between junction 12 and 13 because of an earlier breakdown .
meanwhile , eight weeks of roadworks start this morning in newport .
closures will be in place on wellington road and avenue road , with two-way traffic lights on the high street .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: headlines : 'shocking ' data on child sex offences ; upset over wind turbines ; £ 500k roadworks
text: - new figures for child sex offences are 'shocking ' , says telford and wrekin council
- residents in pant complain about daily wind turbine deliveries through their village
- roadworks costing £ 500,000 start in newport today
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: we might see some showers today and we will have highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
find out more .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning and welcome to our live page for shropshire
text: hello from the bbc newsroom in shropshire .
this is your place for all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
you can get in touch by email , twitter or by commenting on our facebook page .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather watchers : some bright skies over shropshire
text: the bbc weather watchers have been sending in photos of cloudy skies from around shropshire today .
but it 's not all been dark and gloomy .
this photo was taken at norton in hales earlier .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: hospital patients create knitted hand-warmers for football club
text: hundreds of knitted hand warmers , known as twiddlemuffs , have been created by patients at hospitals in shrewsbury and telford since the muff-making project started a year ago .
the idea is to give people with dementia something to do with their hands , but it 's also proved helpful for patients undergoing chemotherapy or those with learning difficulties .
they 've included these shrewsbury town-themed twiddlemuffs , created by jo betts from shrewsbury .
she got a donation from the club to make them and thought it might stir some happy memories for the patients .

documents.title: your photos : heavy cloud over ludlow
text: we 've seen some dramatic photos of the cloud over shropshire today , sent in by the bbc weather watchers .
this one was taken this afternoon over ludlow .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: labour councillor under investigation by party
text: a senior telford and wrekin labour councillor is under investigation by his party over claims he voted at branch meetings in two different areas - which would be against party rules .
but councillor lee carter , who is backing owen smith in the party 's leadership contest , has tweeted to claim it 's because he is n't supporting labour party leader jeremy corbyn .
i'n now under investigation by local lp for not supporting jc .
sad times .
love for labour will not leave me .
crazy .
what happened to democratic choice ?
it 's alive as long as you support jc by the looks !
stick to your principles .
political bullies are the worst kind !
there are 13 complainants in total- add a nought to that number and i 'd bat an eyelid .
frankly ?
sod 'em !
while they 're busy writing letters and quashing dissent , i 'll be busy representing people of college and doing best for t & w
yes .
the best way forward .
genuinely have some sympathy for moderate members of lab party .
take this the right way mate- but that shows how bad things are : - )
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: slip-road closures on m54 in shropshire
text: drivers face roadworks on the m54 in shropshire from tonight .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : labour party investigates councillor ; independent investigation into a53 crash ; turbine parts pass through county
text: our top stories this evening :
- under investigation labour councillor blames corbyn supporters
- independent police investigation into fatal a53 crash
- convoy of lorries carrying giant turbine parts passes through county
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police in shrewsbury hunt arsonist after spate of fires
text: the police say they believe a series of fires in the bowbrook area of shrewsbury have been started deliberately .
the last one was reported at 01:37 in steepside and the fire service is also investigating .
we are aware of a spate of small but deliberate fires in the bowbrook area of shrewsbury .
usually rubbish or shrubbery being set alight .

documents.title: watch : work starts on bbc radio shropshire mural
text: work has started on the bbc radio shropshire mural in telford town centre .
it 's being created with the help of a local artist , but we want your ideas .
if you ca n't get to the shopping centre , you can email them to me .
author: Paul Shuttleworth
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: woman describes attempt to steal forklift truck
text: the police say there were a series of crimes reported in and around the audlem , woore and norton-in-hales areas before a police pursuit which ended with one man dying in a crash on the a53 .
elizabeth huntbach , from audlem , told bbc radio shropshire her son norman huntbach was run over last night .
she said he had tried to stop men stealing his forklift truck and was left with a serious knee injury and a wound to his arm .
cheshire police believes the same car was involved in this incident and the police pursuit .
we were at our son norman 's house for a dinner party when he saw a car come in his yard .
he went out to ask what was the matter and he found thieves trying to steal something .
a forklift truck
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : first day on the job for telford 's new commercial manager
text: there have been some behind-the-scenes changes at afc telford united , including the appointment of a new commercial manager .
he previously held a similar position at northamptonshire cricket club .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: independent police investigators looking into a53 crash
text: the independent police complaints commission says it has started an investigation into the fatal crash on the a53 near market drayton last night .
it says the driver of a vauxhall corsa died after being in collision with another car , while being followed by a west mercia police vehicle .
the ipcc also said it was notified of the incident at about midnight and sent investigators to the scene .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : investigation into a53 crash death ; wartime device disrupts rail services ; wind turbine parts pass through
text: here 's a recap of our top stories :
- independent investigation into crash following police pursuit
- rail services disrupted after wartime device found near tracks
- giant wind turbine parts driven through county
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your comments : cinema group looks at other options
text: the news that the clifton cinema group is going to look at other potential sites for an arts venue in wellington has been getting some reaction on bbc shropshire 's facebook page .
and it seems people think this might be the end for the dream of reopening the building .
martin hughes wrote : `` when i lived in shrewsbury i went to see saturday night fever here back in the 70 's we knew the manager there and he was having alterations done at the time .
we sat on makeshift seats in what would be the stalls .
sorry to hear this sad news just hope it gets saved . ''
we should point out the clifton cinema group says it still hopes to reopen the building one day .
andy swain wrote : `` always been my dream to buy this place and refurbish it .
if ever i win the lottery . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: your photos : sunset over the water at ellesmere
text: this photo of the sun setting over the water at ellesmere last night was sent in by one of the bbc weather watchers .
you can share your photos by getting in touch through email , twitter or by commenting on our facebook page .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police pursuit crash : car 'involved in crime ' say officers
text: the independent police complaints commission says it was the driver of a vauxhall corsa who died after being in collision with another car near newcastle-under-lyme last night .
it 's investigating because the corsa was being followed on the a53 by a west mercia police vehicle at the time .

meanwhile a series of tweets from market drayton 's safer neighbourhood team said the p-registration burgundy corsa had earlier been involved in crime in cheshire and the villages of woore and norton-in-hales in shropshire .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'wartime bomb ' disrupts rail travel
text: 'wartime bomb ' disrupts rail travel

documents.title: american football : revolution 's winning run continues
text: the shropshire revolution continued their push for a play-off place with a 26-6 win over bottom-of-the-table lincolnshire bombers yesterday .
they still have to win their final match to secure second place and that will be away to the humber warhawks on 7 august .
the revolution also have to hope their play-off rivals staffordshire surge lose to the division 's top team , the leicester falcons .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: first wind turbine convoys pass through county
text: the first convoys of lorries carrying giant wind farm parts are passing through shropshire today .

they 're travelling from a site in yorkshire to cefn coch , near welshpool , powys , with a police escort and there will be one of these convoys a day now , six days a week , for the next two months .
dates of key local events and the august bank holiday weekend will be avoided .
just passing mile end # oswestry .

documents.title: video : the latest west midlands weather forecast
text: what weather 's in store for us over the coming 24 hours ?
better get those umbrellas out .

documents.title: quarter of shropshire 's pharmacies under threat of closure
text: a quarter of shropshire 's chemist shops could close under government plans to cut subsidies .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : wartime device disrupts rail services ; man dies in crash following police pursuit
text: our top stories this lunchtime include :
- rail services resume after wartime device near track found to be harmless
- man dies in crash after police pursuit
- cinema group to look for other arts centre venues
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: wartime device found near railway was harmless
text: the police earlier put up a cordon and evacuated homes at ruabon after a wartime device was found in a garden near the railway line .
but an explosives team from chester have now confirmed it was a training mortar and not dangerous .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: railway line reopens after bomb discovery
text: the railway line between shrewsbury and chester is open again , following the discovery earlier of a suspected wartime bomb between ruabon and wrexham .
# wrexhamgeneral lines are now open .
apologies for any disruption .
please check @ twitterid for service information .

documents.title: radio shropshire creates giant mural in telford shopping centre
text: radio shropshire is at the telford shopping centre all week , creating a giant mural with the help of local graffiti artist neil willis .
the made in telford project is inviting people to go along and suggest what should be included .
work starts at 13:00 today .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: breakingwartime bomb found near railway track
text: a wartime bomb has been found near the railway track between shrewsbury and wrexham , arriva trains wales is reporting .
it means train services on that section of the line have been suspended and replaced by buses .
due to a wartime bomb near the railway between shrewsbury and wrexham general the line is closed .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury town play away friendly tonight
text: shrewsbury town 's pre-season preparations continue tonight with a friendly away to stourbridge .
they beat solihull moors 4-0 away from home over the weekend , with goals from leitch-smith , dodds , sarcevic and whalley .
afc telford united welcome wrexham to the bucks head tomorrow .

documents.title: weather : light cloud covering shropshire today
text: this light cloud is forecast to remain over shropshire for the rest of the day .
here 's a look at the weather for the west midlands region .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: council blames government for affordable home shortage in villages
text: shropshire council has blamed the government for the shortage of affordable homes in the county .
it follows claims young people are being priced out of living in villages because of a lack of starter housing .
shropshire council says there are nearly 18,000 social or affordable homes in the authority 's area , with about 400 built last year .
but councillor mal price , the member of the conservative-run council responsible for housing , says the government needs to offer more support .
this is n't a shropshire issue , it is a national issue .
the government are not delivering on the number of affordable houses they said they would do

documents.title: golf tournament for girls in llanymynech
text: a girls ' golf tournament has attracted 30 competitors to llanymynech golf club today .
the players in the shropshire junior girls golf championship all play 36 holes .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: cinema group to look at other options
text: a group that was set up to acquire the old clifton cinema in wellington and turn it into an arts centre has agreed to look for other possible venues .

the clifton community arts project has n't abandoned its efforts to save the art-deco building , but has grown tired of the uncertainty surrounding the site , which is still owned by the dunelm retail group .
it was originally on the market for more than £ 1m , but council valuers now think it 's worth just a fraction of that .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: homeless charity now working on the streets of shrewsbury
text: a charity that helps people who are homeless is extending its work thanks to a £ 25,000 grant from shropshire council .
the ark drop-in centre in shrewsbury has now appointed an outreach worker to actively look for rough-sleepers .
i 've been out with tim compton from the ark , who said an important part of their work is done in the early hours of the morning .
we go out early mornings , sometimes to see established rough sleepers often to respond to reports of new rough sleepers
author: Les Walton
